chunks.cleaned_english_translation: When it comes to appeals, judges from a different province shouldn't hear the case. If a cleric is accused of a crime, the proceedings should take place in the province where the accused resides. The accuser shouldn't consider taking the cleric to a court in a different or more distant location.
chunks.original_latin:
EX EODEM UT SUPRA. Super appellatione, alterius provinciae judices audire
non oportet. Si quis clericus super quibuslibet criminibus accusatus
fuerit, in provincia, in qua consistit ille qui
pulsatur, suas exerceat actiones: nec existimet eum
accusator suus alibi, aut longius ad judicium protrahendum.
